title: Self-Organization is Resistance
summary: A deep exploration of how building parallel systems serves as the most effective form of resistance. Shows how self-organizing communities can make centralized power structures irrelevant rather than fighting them directly.

Narrative.summary: Understand resistance as building alternatives rather than fighting existing systems.

level0: Recognize that the most effective resistance makes old systems irrelevant
Understand self-organization as natural system behavior, not radical action
level1: See current moment of institutional change as opportunity, not just chaos
Frame local projects as resistance activities, not just lifestyle choices
level2: Develop vision of post-permission economy based on creation rather than extraction
Understand how parallel systems can influence larger structures
level3: Articulate and teach self-organization principles to broader audiences
Connect local resistance activities to global movements for change

Communication.summary: Build decentralized communication networks that operate outside corporate surveillance platforms.

level0: Start using federated, open-source communication tools
Reduce dependence on corporate social media platforms
level1: Help neighbors set up privacy-respecting communication tools
Create local communication networks for community organizing
level2: Establish redundant communication systems for community resilience
Build skills in mesh networking and offline communication
level3: Create communication infrastructure that serves multiple communities
Teach others to build and maintain decentralized networks

Community.summary: Create local networks that provide mutual aid and shared resources outside traditional market systems.

level0: Join or start neighborhood tool libraries
Participate in local Buy Nothing groups or skill shares
level1: Organize community gardens and local food networks
Create knowledge-sharing networks and peer-led education
level2: Establish makerspaces and shared workshop facilities
Build local energy solutions and resource sharing systems
level3: Connect multiple local networks into regional resilience systems
Mentor other communities in self-organization principles

Knowledge.summary: Create open education systems that challenge institutional gatekeeping of information.

level0: Share knowledge freely rather than hoarding professional expertise
level1: Organize skill-sharing workshops and community education
level2: Create comprehensive learning networks that bypass traditional institutions
Develop curricula for practical resilience skills
level3: Build educational systems that serve community needs rather than corporate profits
Train others to become knowledge facilitators and community teachers
